figures.title: Transesophageal Echocardiogram Showing Atrial Septal Defect
figures.description: This is a transesophageal echocardiographic image displaying cardiac anatomy in a fan-shaped ultrasound view. The image clearly shows the right atrium (RA) and left atrium (LA) separated by the atrial septum, with measurement markers indicating an atrial septal defect diameter of 1.49 cm. The ultrasound parameters show a 2D image at 75% gain with specific temperature readings, demonstrating the diagnostic imaging used to assess congenital heart defects. The grayscale ultrasound provides detailed visualization of cardiac structures necessary for evaluating the size and location of the septal defect.
figures.caption: FIGURE 1: Transesophageal view showing the atrial septal defect (ASD) diameter

figures.title: Transesophageal Echocardiogram with Color Doppler Imaging
figures.description: This is a medical ultrasound image showing a transesophageal echocardiogram (TEE) with color Doppler overlay. The grayscale ultrasound image shows cardiac structures in cross-section, while the blue and red colored areas indicate blood flow direction and velocity detected by Doppler imaging. The prominent blue coloration suggests significant blood flow in one direction, likely indicating normal or abnormal cardiac blood flow patterns that would be relevant for diagnostic assessment.

figures.title: Fluoroscopic View of ASD Device Deployment
figures.description: This is a fluoroscopic (X-ray) medical image showing the deployment of an atrial septal defect (ASD) closure device. The image captures a cardiac catheterization procedure where a specialized occluder device is being positioned to close a hole in the atrial septum of the heart. The fluoroscopic guidance allows real-time visualization of the device placement, with the catheter delivery system visible as it guides the closure device into the proper position within the heart's septal defect.
figures.caption: VIDEO 2: Fluoroscopic view of atrial septal defect device deployment
